title: Add unit tests for core services
description: Implement comprehensive unit tests for all core services using Vitest. Cover StorageService JSONL persistence, GraphService dependency management, CompactionService issue summarization, and GitService version control integration.
notes: Key learnings: Vitest provides better DX than Jest for TypeScript projects. Colocated tests improve maintainability. Mocking simple-git required careful setup. Test coverage includes edge cases like empty files, dependency cycles, and git repo detection.
acceptance_criteria: All core services have >80% test coverage

title: Implement integration tests for git sync
notes: Starting integration tests for git sync functionality. Need to test end-to-end git operations including commits, pushes, and conflict resolution.

title: Add error handling and validation to CLI commands
Implement autonomous execution capabilities for agents
description: Implement MCP tools or API endpoints that allow autonomous agents to interact with Horizon without requiring manual CLI command approval. Enable programmatic access to create, update, list, and manage tasks through direct API calls rather than shell commands.
acceptance_criteria: Agents can create and update tasks without manual approval
Agents can query task status and ready work autonomously
API supports all core Horizon operations
notes: Self-review: Code follows TypeScript best practices, handles edge cases like missing .horizon, has basic error handling, includes comprehensive tests, all dependencies resolved. Acceptance criteria met: Agents can now autonomously manage tasks with CLI commands.

title: Fix upward search for .horizon directory from any subdirectory
notes: Updated MCP server to also use findHorizonDir function for upward directory search. Previously only CLI had this fix, causing MCP server to create .horizon folders in wrong locations.

title: Make Horizon available as npx command globally
notes: Renamed CLI package to 'horizon' and published for npx usage

title: Add support for different task types (epic, feature, task, bug)
notes: Added IssueType to interface, updated CLI commands for create/update/list with type support

title: Implement MCP server for programmatic task management
notes: Implemented MCP server with tools for create, update, list, add_dependency, get_ready_work using @modelcontextprotocol/sdk

title: Test MCP server integration with MCP clients
description: Verify that the MCP server can be run and tools are available for programmatic access
notes: MCP server builds successfully, tests pass, and server starts. Ready for MCP client integration.

title: Fix concurrency issues in MCP server to prevent race conditions
description: Implement operation serialization to prevent concurrent file access issues. Added withLock method to serialize create/update/dependency operations, and made create operations consistent with rewrite approach instead of mixed append/overwrite.
